description.narrative:
HakiElimu har ansökt om stöd från Sida, 5 miljoner SEK, för de sista två åren av dess strategiska program, 2015 - 2016. Den totala strategiperioden är 2012 - 2016. Totala budgeten för strategiperioden är ca 134,4 miljoner SEK (16,8 miljoner USD) och för de två sista åren är den budgeten ca 56,8 miljoner SEK (7,1 miljoner USD). HakiElimu har för närvarande avtal med den kanadensiska och irländska ambassaden samt Terre des hommes.
HakiElimu är en civilsamhällesorganisation som arbetar för alla tanzaniers rätt till kvalitativ utbildning som främjar jämlikhet, kreativitet och kritiskt tänkande. Organisationens vision är ett öppet, rättvist och demokratiskt Tanzania där offentlig debatt och dialog stimuleras och där ansvar utkrävs av beslutsfattare och folkvalda representanter.
HakiElimu avser nå följande tre övergripande resultat i sitt arbete: 1) Barn går i skolan och tillgodogör sig kunskaper och lärande; 2) Medborgare är informerade, medvetna och trygga samt aktivt engagerade; och 3) Regeringen är öppen, mottaglig och ansvarig. Organisationens underliggande ide är att medborgare med tillräckliga kunskaper och självförtroende aktivt kan bidra till förändring och påverka utvecklingen i samhället samt utkräva ansvar från beslutsfattare. För att nå de förväntade resultaten planerar HakiElimu att arbeta inom framför allt tre områden såsom: media och påverkan; medborgarengagemang; samt forskning och policyanalys.

HakiElimu has applied to Sida for funding to implement the last two years, 2015 - 2016, of HakiElimu's Strategic Program 2012 - 2016. The total budget for the strategy peiod is approximately 134,4 million SEK (16,8 million USD) and the budget for the last two years is approximately 56,8 million SEK (7,1 million USD). HakiElimu is currently recieveing financial support from the Irish and Canadian Embassy and Terre des hommes.
HakiElimu's vision is to support the creation of an open, just and democratic society with quality education for all. The aim of the intervention is to enable people to transform education, in and out of schools; influence policy making and effective implementation; stimulate public dialogue and social change; conduct research, policy analysis and advocacy; and collaborate with partners to advance participation, accountability transparency and social justice.
The strategy aims at ensuring: 1) Children are in schools and actively learning; 2) Citizens are informed, confident and actively engage, and 3) Government, from the national level to schools are accountable and responsive.
To be able to realize the three programme outcomes above, HakiElimu will employ the following strategies: 1) Media and Advocacy; 2) Citizen Engagement and Action, and 3) Operational/Action Research and Policy Analysis.

HakiElimu's vision is an open, just and democratic Tanzania where all people enjoy the right to education that promotes equity, creativity and critical thinking. The expected outcomes are that; Children are in school and actively learning; citizens are informed, confident and actively engaged; and that goverment is open, responsive and accountable.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The intervention has reached its intended outcome both at national and local level. At national level HakiElimu has influenced for establishment of two key processes towards improving learning environment in Tanzania. One is ETP (Education and Training Policy that was launched in 2014. Series of HakiElimu research, publications and policy briefs resulted in to development of education policy which introduced fee free basic education by the government. Two is enactment of Teacher Service Commission in 2016 to regulate, mediate and work on challenges that teachers are facing. The teacher service Commission is already formed though not very effective as it takes some time for new institution to learn and delver effectively. At local level, HakiElimu has recruited more than 35000 friends of education who voluntarily commit to support HakiElimu's initiatives through working with communities at local level. HakiElimu has managed to work with all 11 districts in Tanzania as it was planned.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
